item.title: Air Fryer Rotisserie Chicken
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 lemon
  • 1 small garlic bulb
  • Fresh thyme or rosemary (optional)

Pantry

  • Olive oil
  • Honey (optional for glaze)

Spices

  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Paprika
  • Garlic powder
  • Onion powder
  • Dried oregano
  • Ground cumin (optional)

Proteins

  • 1 whole chicken (1.4‚Äì1.8 kg), UK supermarket standard

Other

  • Butcher‚Äôs twine (optional)

Utensils List

  • Air fryer (basket or dual-zone)
  • Small bowl for spice rub
  • Brush or spoon for applying oil
  • Tongs
  • Meat thermometer (recommended)

Ingredients (Serves 4)

  • 1 whole chicken (1.4‚Äì1.8 kg)
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 2 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp black pepper
  • 2 tsp paprika
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • 1 tsp dried oregano
  • ¬Ω tsp ground cumin (optional)
  • 1 lemon, halved
  • 3‚Äì4 garlic cloves or ¬Ω bulb, smashed
  • Fresh thyme/rosemary (optional)

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Remove giblets from the chicken cavity if present.
  2. Pat the chicken completely dry with kitchen paper‚Äîthis is key for crisp skin.
  3. Tie the legs together with butcher‚Äôs twine (optional but helps even cooking).
  4. Mix all spices in a small bowl.
  5. Rub the chicken with olive oil, then coat evenly with the spice mix.
  6. Stuff the cavity with lemon halves, garlic, and herbs.

Cooking Instructions (Air Fryer)

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 180¬∞C for 3 minutes.
  2. Place the chicken breast-side down in the basket.
  3. Cook for 40 minutes at 180¬∞C.
  4. Carefully flip the chicken breast-side up.
  5. Cook for an additional 20‚Äì25 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 75¬∞C in the thickest part of the breast/thigh.
  6. Optional glaze: Mix 1 tbsp honey + 1 tsp olive oil and brush over the skin in the final 5 minutes for extra shine.
  7. Rest the chicken for at least 10 minutes before carving.

Storage & Reheating Instructions

Storage

  • Fridge: Store carved chicken in airtight containers for up to 3 days.
  • Freezer: Freeze portions for up to 3 months.

Reheating

  • Air fryer: 160¬∞C for 5‚Äì7 minutes.
  • Microwave: Reheat covered to retain moisture.
  • Tip: Add a splash of chicken stock when reheating to keep it juicy.

Enjoy tender, crispy, rotisserie-style chicken at home‚Äîno rotating spit required!

item.title: Banana Bread
item.description:
Banana Bread

Grocery List

Produce

  • 3 ripe bananas

Pantry

  • Plain flour
  • Granulated sugar
  • Baking powder
  • Baking soda
  • Vegetable oil (or melted butter)
  • Vanilla extract

Spices

  • Ground cinnamon
  • Salt

Proteins

  • Eggs

Other

  • Baking parchment (optional)

Utensils List

  • Mixing bowls
  • Fork or masher
  • Whisk or spoon
  • Loaf tin (1 lb or 2 lb)
  • Oven or air fryer
  • Measuring cups/spoons

Ingredients (Makes 1 loaf)

  • 3 ripe bananas, mashed
  • 200 g plain flour
  • 120 g sugar
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • ¬Ω tsp baking soda
  • ¬Ω tsp salt
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 2 eggs
  • 80 ml vegetable oil (or 75 g melted butter)
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Line the loaf tin with parchment or lightly grease it.
  2. Mash the bananas until smooth.
  3. Pre-measure dry ingredients to speed up mixing.

Cooking Instructions

Oven Method

  1. Preheat oven to 175¬∞C.
  2. In a bowl, mix mashed bananas, eggs, oil, and vanilla.
  3. In another bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
  4. Fold dry ingredients into wet until just combined‚Äîdo not overmix.
  5. Pour batter into loaf tin.
  6. Bake for 50‚Äì60 minutes, or until a skewer comes out clean.
  7. Cool in the tin for 10 minutes, then transfer to a rack.

Air Fryer Method

  1. Preheat air fryer to 150¬∞C.
  2. Prepare batter as above.
  3. Pour into a small loaf tin that fits the basket.
  4. Air fry for 35‚Äì45 minutes. Check after 30 minutes.
  5. Let cool before slicing.

Storage & Reheating Instructions

  • Room temperature: Store wrapped for up to 3 days.
  • Fridge: Keeps 5‚Äì7 days in an airtight container.
  • Freeze: Slice and freeze up to 3 months; thaw at room temperature.
  • Reheat: Warm slices in microwave for 10‚Äì15 seconds or toast lightly.

item.title: Beef Barbacoa
item.description:
Beef Barbacoa (Slow Cooker)

A tender, richly seasoned Mexican-style beef barbacoa made easily in a slow cooker.

üõí Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 large onion
  • 4 garlic cloves
  • 2 limes (for juice)
  • 2 bay leaves (optional but recommended)

Pantry

  • Beef broth or water (1 cup)
  • Apple cider vinegar (2 tbsp)
  • Corn tortillas (for serving, optional)

Spices

  • Oregano
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Paprika
  • Ground cumin
  • Ground cloves

Proteins

  • 1.2‚Äì1.5 kg chuck steak (or beef brisket)

Other

  • Chipotle in adobo (1‚Äì2 peppers, optional but traditional)
  • Cooking oil (any)

üîß Utensils List

  • Slow cooker
  • Cutting board
  • Knife
  • Measuring spoons
  • Small bowl
  • Forks for shredding

ü•ò Ingredients (Serves 6)

  • 1.2‚Äì1.5 kg chuck steak, trimmed and cut into large chunks
  • 1 large onion, roughly chopped
  • 4 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1‚Äì2 chipotle peppers in adobo, chopped (optional but adds smoky heat)
  • 1 cup beef broth (or water)
  • 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • Juice of 2 limes
  • 2 tsp oregano
  • 2 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • ¬Ω tsp ground cloves
  • 1¬Ω tsp salt (adjust to taste)
  • 1 tsp black pepper
  • 2 bay leaves (optional)

üßë‚Äçüç≥ Meal Prep Steps

  1. Chop the onion and mince the garlic.
  2. Cut the chuck steak into large fist-sized pieces for even cooking.
  3. Mix the dry spices in a small bowl: oregano, cumin, paprika, cloves, salt, and pepper.
  4. If using chipotle peppers, chop them ahead of time.
  5. Juice the limes and set aside.

üî• Cooking Instructions (Slow Cooker)

  1. Sear the beef (optional but adds flavor):
    Heat a little oil in a pan and brown each side of the beef chunks. Transfer to the slow cooker.

item.title: Beef Chorizo
item.description:
Beef Chorizo (Mexican-Style)

Grocery List

Produce

  • Garlic cloves
  • Onion (optional)

Pantry

  • Apple cider vinegar
  • Olive oil
  • Tomato pur√©e
  • Soft brown sugar (optional)

Spices

  • Paprika
  • Smoked paprika
  • Ground cumin
  • Ground coriander
  • Dried oregano
  • Ground cinnamon
  • Ground cloves
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Chilli flakes or hot chilli powder
  • Optional: Ancho or chipotle paste

Proteins

  • Beef mince (10‚Äì20% fat)

Other

  • Food-safe gloves (optional)

Utensils List

  • Mixing bowl
  • Measuring spoons
  • Frying pan or skillet
  • Airtight container

Ingredients (scaled to 4 servings)

  • 500g beef mince
  • 3 tbsp paprika
  • 1 tbsp smoked paprika
  • 1 tsp ground cumin
  • 1 tsp ground coriander
  • 1 tsp dried oregano
  • 1/4 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 1/8 tsp ground cloves
  • 1‚Äì2 tsp chilli flakes or hot chilli powder
  • 1.5 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp black pepper
  • 4 garlic cloves, finely minced
  • 1 tbsp tomato pur√©e
  • 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1 tsp soft brown sugar (optional)
  • 1 tbsp olive oil (optional, if mince is lean)

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Place the beef mince into a mixing bowl.
  2. Add all spices, minced garlic, tomato pur√©e, vinegar, and optional sugar.
  3. Mix thoroughly with your hands until the mixture becomes sticky and uniform.
  4. Adjust seasoning and heat level to your preference.
  5. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, ideally overnight.

Cooking Instructions

  1. Heat a frying pan over medium heat.
  2. Add a little olive oil if the beef is very lean.
  3. Crumble the chorizo mixture into the pan.
  4. Cook for 8‚Äì10 minutes, breaking it apart until browned and slightly crispy.
  5. Optional: Add diced onion and cook 3‚Äì4 minutes extra.
  6. Use in tacos, quesadillas, eggs, rice bowls, or stuffed peppers.

Storage & Reheating Instructions

  • Uncooked (fridge): Up to 2 days
  • Cooked (fridge): Up to 4 days
  • Frozen (cooked or uncooked): Up to 3 months
  • Reheat:
    • Pan: 3‚Äì5 minutes
    • Microwave: 1‚Äì2 minutes

item.title: Chicken Mole
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 large onion
  • 3 garlic cloves
  • 1‚Äì2 jalape√±os (optional, for extra heat)
  • Fresh coriander (cilantro), optional
  • 1 lime (optional, for serving)

Pantry

  • 1 jar of store-bought mole paste (e.g., Do√±a Maria)
  • Chicken stock or water
  • Olive oil or vegetable oil
  • Tortillas or rice (for serving)

Spices

  • Salt
  • Black pepper

Proteins

  • 600‚Äì800 g chicken thighs (boneless or bone-in)

Other

  • Sesame seeds (optional garnish)

Utensils List

  • Large pot or deep pan
  • Wooden spoon
  • Knife and chopping board
  • Measuring jug

Ingredients (Serves 4)

  • 600‚Äì800 g chicken thighs
  • 1 jar store-bought mole paste (approx. 235 g)
  • 750‚Äì900 ml chicken stock or water
  • 1 onion, sliced
  • 3 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1‚Äì2 jalape√±os, sliced (optional)
  • 1 tbsp oil
  • Salt & pepper to taste
  • Sesame seeds, for garnish
  • Lime wedges & coriander, optional

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Slice the onion and mince the garlic.
  2. Slice jalape√±os if using.
  3. Season chicken thighs with a little salt and pepper.
  4. Measure out your stock or water.

Cooking Instructions

1. Saut√© the aromatics

  • Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pot over medium heat.
  • Add onions and cook 5 minutes until softened.
  • Add garlic and cook 1 minute more.
  • Add jalape√±os if using.

2. Brown the chicken

  • Add chicken thighs to the pot and lightly brown on both sides (2‚Äì3 minutes per side).
  • They don‚Äôt need to be cooked through.

3. Build the mole sauce

  • Add the entire jar of mole paste into the pot.
  • Pour in 750‚Äì900 ml stock or water.
  • Stir until the paste dissolves into a smooth sauce.

4. Simmer

  • Bring to a gentle simmer.
  • Cover and cook for 25‚Äì35 minutes (boneless) or 40‚Äì50 minutes (bone-in), until chicken is tender.
  • Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
  • If sauce thickens too much, add a splash of water.

5. Adjust seasoning

  • Taste and add salt or pepper as needed.
  • If you want it sweeter (common in mole), add 1‚Äì2 tsp sugar.
  • If you want it richer, add a small piece of dark chocolate.

6. Serve

  • Serve over rice or with warm tortillas.
  • Garnish with sesame seeds, coriander, and lime.

Storage & Reheating Instructions

  • Fridge: Keeps 3‚Äì4 days in an airtight container.
  • Freezer: Freeze up to 3 months; thaw overnight before reheating.
  • Reheat: Warm in a pot over low heat with a splash of water to loosen the sauce. Microwave in 1-minute intervals, stirring between each.

Enjoy your quick and flavourful chicken mole!

item.title: Enfrijoladas
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 small white onion
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • Fresh coriander (optional garnish)

Pantry

  • 1 can black beans (400g)
  • 8 corn tortillas
  • Vegetable oil
  • 200ml water or low-salt vegetable stock
  • 50g feta or queso fresco (or crumbly cheese alternative)

Spices

  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • 1 tsp ground cumin
  • 1 tsp smoked paprika (optional)

Proteins

  • None (vegetarian dish)

Other

  • Sour cream or cr√®me fra√Æche (optional topping)

Utensils List

  • Blender or immersion blender
  • Frying pan
  • Small saucepan
  • Ladle
  • Tongs or spatula

Ingredients (Serves 2)

  • 1 can (400g) black beans, drained (keep a splash of liquid)
  • 200ml water or vegetable stock
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • ¬Ω small white onion, chopped (reserve the rest as garnish)
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • Salt & pepper to taste
  • 8 small corn tortillas
  • 2 tbsp vegetable oil
  • 50g feta or queso fresco, crumbled
  • Optional: sour cream, chopped coriander

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Chop the onion and peel the garlic.
  2. Drain beans but keep 1‚Äì2 tbsp of the liquid for blending.
  3. Warm tortillas in a dry pan or microwave so they don‚Äôt crack when folded.
  4. Set toppings ready: crumble cheese, chop coriander, slice remaining onion.

Cooking Instructions

1. Make the bean sauce

  1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
  2. Add the chopped onion and cook until soft (3‚Äì4 minutes).
  3. Add garlic, cumin, and paprika (if using), cook 30 seconds.
  4. Add black beans, bean liquid, and the water/stock.
  5. Simmer for 5 minutes, then blend until smooth and pourable.
  6. Season with salt & pepper. Thin with more water if needed‚Äîthe sauce should coat a spoon but still flow.

2. Warm the tortillas

  1. Heat a pan with a teaspoon of oil.
  2. Warm each tortilla lightly on both sides (about 10 seconds).
  3. Keep them wrapped in a towel so they stay soft.

3. Assemble

  1. Dip each tortilla into the hot bean sauce.
  2. Fold into quarters (or roll like enchiladas) and set on a plate.
  3. Repeat for all tortillas.

4. Serve

Top with:

item.title: Garlic Pasta
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • Garlic (6‚Äì8 cloves)
  • Fresh parsley (small bunch)
  • Lemon (1, optional)

Pantry

  • Spaghetti or linguine (250g)
  • Olive oil
  • Unsalted butter
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Grated Parmesan or Pecorino

Spices

  • Chilli flakes (optional)

Proteins

  • None (vegetarian)

Other

  • Pasta cooking water (reserved)

Utensils List

  • Large pot
  • Large frying pan or saut√© pan
  • Knife and chopping board
  • Tongs or pasta fork
  • Microplane grater (optional)

Ingredients (2 servings)

  • 250g spaghetti or linguine
  • 6‚Äì8 garlic cloves, thinly sliced
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tbsp butter
  • 1 tsp chilli flakes (optional)
  • Small handful parsley, finely chopped
  • 20‚Äì30g Parmesan, grated
  • Salt & black pepper to taste
  • 60‚Äì120 ml pasta water (as needed)
  • Optional: zest of ¬Ω lemon

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Slice the garlic very thinly.
  2. Chop the parsley.
  3. Grate the cheese.
  4. Zest the lemon if using.
  5. Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil.

Cooking Instructions

  1. Cook the pasta:
    Add spaghetti to the boiling salted water and cook until just shy of al dente. Reserve a mug of pasta water.

item.title: Loaded Nachos
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 large tomato
  • 1 small red onion
  • 2 spring onions
  • 1 jalape√±o or green chilli
  • 1 lime
  • Fresh coriander (small bunch)

Pantry

  • 1 large bag tortilla chips
  • 1 can black beans
  • 1 jar salsa (mild or hot)
  • 1 small can sweetcorn
  • Vegetable oil (optional)

Spices

  • Ground cumin
  • Smoked paprika
  • Salt & pepper

Proteins

  • None (vegetarian)

Other

  • 150‚Äì200g grated cheddar or a cheddar‚Äìmozzarella mix
  • Sour cream (optional)
  • Guacamole (optional)

Utensils List

  • Baking tray or oven-safe dish
  • Small saucepan
  • Knife and chopping board
  • Mixing bowl
  • Spoon

Ingredients (Serves 2‚Äì3)

  • 1 large bag tortilla chips (approx. 180‚Äì200g)
  • 150‚Äì200g grated cheddar (or mix)
  • 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
  • 1 small can sweetcorn, drained
  • 1 tomato, diced
  • 1 small red onion, finely diced
  • 1 jalape√±o, sliced
  • 2 spring onions, sliced
  • ¬Ω tsp cumin
  • ¬Ω tsp smoked paprika
  • Salt & pepper
  • 4‚Äì5 tbsp salsa
  • Sour cream & guacamole for serving
  • Lime wedges

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Drain and rinse the beans; drain the sweetcorn.
  2. Dice the tomato and red onion.
  3. Slice jalape√±o and spring onions.
  4. Pre-mix beans, sweetcorn, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
  5. Grate cheese if not pre-grated.

Cooking Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (fan).
  2. Layer the nachos:
    • Spread half the tortilla chips on a baking tray.
    • Scatter half the cheese.
    • Spoon half the bean‚Äìcorn mix.
    • Repeat with remaining chips, cheese, and beans.
  3. Bake for 8‚Äì10 minutes until cheese is fully melted.
  4. Top after baking:
    • Add diced tomato, red onion, jalape√±o, spring onions, and spoonfuls of salsa.
  5. Serve with lime wedges, sour cream, and guacamole.

Storage & Reheating Instructions

  • Nachos are best eaten immediately; they lose crispness once cooled.
  • If storing:
    • Keep toppings separate and store the baked chips/cheese in an airtight container for up to 1 day.
  • Reheat in the oven at 170¬∞C for 5 minutes to crisp again.
  • Add fresh toppings after reheating.

item.title: Pibil Pork
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 large orange (for juice)
  • 2 limes
  • 1 red onion
  • 4 garlic cloves

Pantry

  • 1 packet store-bought achiote paste (e.g., El Yucateco or similar)
  • Apple cider vinegar
  • Chicken stock or water
  • Corn tortillas (for serving, optional)

Spices

  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Oregano (optional)

Proteins

  • 1.2‚Äì1.5 kg pork shoulder (boneless or bone-in)

Other

  • Banana leaves (optional, for lining slow cooker)
  • Pickled red onions (optional for serving)

Utensils List

  • Slow cooker
  • Mixing bowl
  • Citrus juicer (optional)
  • Knife & chopping board

Ingredients (4‚Äì6 servings)

  • 1.2‚Äì1.5 kg pork shoulder, cut into large chunks
  • 50‚Äì100 g store-bought achiote paste (¬Ω‚Äì1 block)
  • Juice of 1 large orange
  • Juice of 2 limes
  • 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 4 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1 small red onion, sliced
  • 120 ml chicken stock or water
  • 1 tsp salt (adjust to taste)
  • ¬Ω tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp dried oregano (optional)

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Cut pork shoulder into large chunks (roughly fist-sized).
  2. Mince the garlic and slice the red onion.
  3. Juice the orange and limes.
  4. In a bowl, crumble the achiote paste and mix with citrus juice, vinegar, garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and stock to form a marinade.
  5. Optional: Rinse banana leaves with warm water to soften.

Cooking Instructions (Slow Cooker)

  1. Prepare the base

item.title: Quesadillas
item.description:
Quesadillas with Optional Proteins

Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 onion
  • 1 tomato
  • 1‚Äì2 jalape√±os (optional)
  • Fresh coriander (optional)
  • 1 lime (optional, for serving)

Pantry

  • Flour tortillas (medium or large)
  • Vegetable oil or butter
  • Salsa or hot sauce (optional)

Spices

  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Paprika (optional)
  • Cumin (optional)

Proteins (Optional)

  • Cooked shredded chicken
  • Cooked beef (e.g., leftover steak, mince, or barbacoa)
  • Cooked chorizo
  • Refried beans or whole black beans

Other

  • Grated cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or a Mexican blend)

Utensils List

  • Non-stick frying pan or skillet
  • Spatula
  • Cutting board
  • Knife

Ingredients (Serves 2‚Äì3)

  • 4 flour tortillas
  • 200g grated cheese
  • ¬Ω onion, diced
  • 1 tomato, diced
  • 1 jalape√±o, finely chopped (optional)
  • 1 tbsp oil or butter

Optional protein fillings (choose one or mix):

item.title: Rancheros eggs
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 medium onion
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • 2 tomatoes (or 1 can chopped tomatoes)
  • 1 jalape√±o or green chilli
  • Fresh coriander (optional)
  • 1 lime (optional)

Pantry

  • Corn tortillas
  • Olive oil or vegetable oil
  • Tomato puree (optional, for richer sauce)

Spices

  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Paprika or smoked paprika
  • Ground cumin
  • Dried oregano

Proteins

  • Eggs (2‚Äì4 depending on serving)

Other

  • Optional toppings: feta or queso fresco, avocado, sour cream (optional)

Utensils List

  • Frying pan
  • Small saucepan
  • Spatula
  • Cutting board & knife

Ingredients (2 servings)

  • 4 eggs
  • 4 corn tortillas
  • 1 tbsp oil (plus extra for tortillas)
  • 1 onion, diced
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • 2 tomatoes, diced (or 200g canned chopped tomatoes)
  • 1 jalape√±o, finely chopped
  • ¬Ω tsp paprika
  • ¬Ω tsp cumin
  • ¬Ω tsp dried oregano
  • Salt & pepper to taste
  • Optional: coriander, lime, cheese, avocado

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Dice the onion, tomatoes, and jalape√±o.
  2. Mince the garlic.
  3. Warm tortillas by lightly frying or toasting them and keep warm.
  4. Crack eggs into a bowl if you want to fry them quickly later.

Cooking Instructions

Make the Ranchero Sauce

  1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a saucepan on medium heat.
  2. Add onion and cook 3‚Äì4 minutes until softened.
  3. Add garlic and jalape√±o; cook 1 minute.
  4. Stir in tomatoes, paprika, cumin, and oregano.
  5. Season with salt and pepper.
  6. Simmer 8‚Äì10 minutes until thickened. Adjust seasoning.

Cook the Eggs

  1. Heat a lightly oiled frying pan over medium heat.
  2. Crack in the eggs and fry until whites are set but yolks are still runny (or to preferred doneness).
  3. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.

Assemble

  1. Place warm tortillas on plates.
  2. Spoon ranchero sauce over each.
  3. Top with a fried egg.
  4. Add coriander, cheese, lime, or avocado if desired.

Storage & Reheating Instructions

  • Sauce: Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days. Reheat in a pan over low heat.
  • Eggs: Best cooked fresh; avoid storing.
  • Tortillas: Keep wrapped and warm just before serving; can be reheated in a dry pan or microwave.

item.title: Red Chilaquiles
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 white onion
  • 3 garlic cloves
  • 4‚Äì5 large tomatoes (or 1 tin chopped tomatoes)
  • 1 jalape√±o or 1‚Äì2 dried arbol chillies (optional)
  • Fresh coriander (optional)
  • 1 lime (optional garnish)

Pantry

  • Corn tortillas (8‚Äì10)
  • Vegetable oil
  • Tomato paste (optional, for colour)
  • Salt
  • Pepper

Spices

  • Oregano (Mexican or regular)
  • Paprika (optional)

Proteins (optional toppings)

  • Eggs
  • Cooked shredded chicken
  • Crumbled feta or queso fresco

Other

  • Sour cream (or Greek yoghurt)
  • Avocado (optional)

Utensils List

  • Frying pan or skillet
  • Blender or immersion blender
  • Baking tray (if toasting tortillas instead of frying)
  • Knife and chopping board
  • Tongs

Ingredients (Serves 2)

  • 8‚Äì10 corn tortillas, cut into triangles
  • 2 tbsp vegetable oil (more if frying chips)
  • 4‚Äì5 tomatoes, roughly chopped (or 1 √ó 400g tin chopped tomatoes)
  • 1/2 white onion, chopped
  • 3 garlic cloves
  • 1 jalape√±o or 1‚Äì2 dried arbol chillies (optional for heat)
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • Salt & pepper to taste
  • 1 tsp paprika (optional)
  • 2 eggs (optional: fried or scrambled for serving)
  • Feta/queso fresco, crumbled (optional)
  • Fresh coriander, chopped (optional)

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Cut tortillas into triangles and let them dry for 15‚Äì20 minutes (or leave them out longer for crispier chips).
  2. Prep vegetables: chop tomatoes, onion, garlic, and optional chillies.
  3. Make optional toppings: fry eggs or pull cooked chicken.
  4. Prepare garnishes: chop coriander, slice lime, crumble cheese.

Cooking Instructions

1. Make the Red Sauce

  1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan.
  2. Add chopped onion and saut√© until soft.
  3. Add garlic and optional chillies; cook 1 minute.
  4. Add tomatoes (or tinned tomatoes), oregano, paprika, salt, and pepper.
  5. Simmer 10 minutes.
  6. Blend until smooth; adjust seasoning.

2. Prepare the Tortilla Chips

Option A: Fry (traditional)

item.title: Red Mexican Rice
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 medium onion
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 medium tomato (optional, for extra freshness)
  • 1 lime (optional, for serving)

Pantry

  • Long-grain rice (1 cup)
  • Tomato pur√©e or passata
  • Vegetable stock cube
  • Sunflower or vegetable oil

Spices

  • Ground cumin
  • Salt
  • Black pepper

Proteins

  • None (vegetarian)

Other

  • Water

Utensils List

  • Medium saucepan with lid
  • Wooden spoon
  • Fine sieve (for rinsing rice)
  • Knife and chopping board

Ingredients (serves 4)

  • 1 cup long-grain rice, rinsed until water runs clear
  • 2 tbsp sunflower oil
  • 1 small onion, finely diced
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 3 tbsp tomato pur√©e (or 120 ml passata)
  • 1 ¬Ω cups vegetable stock (made from 1 stock cube)
  • ¬Ω tsp ground cumin
  • ¬Ω tsp salt (adjust to taste)
  • Pinch of black pepper
  • Optional: 1 small tomato, blended or finely chopped for extra colour

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Rinse the rice thoroughly with cold water to remove excess starch.
  2. Dice the onion and mince the garlic.
  3. Prepare the vegetable stock.
  4. If using fresh tomato, blend or finely chop.

Cooking Instructions

  1. Toast the rice:
    Heat the oil in the saucepan over medium heat. Add the rinsed rice and stir frequently for 3‚Äì4 minutes until lightly golden.

item.title: Refried Beans Taco
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 small onion
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • 1 lime
  • Fresh coriander (optional)
  • 1 tomato (for topping)
  • Lettuce (optional)

Pantry

  • 1 can refried beans (or 1 can pinto/black beans)
  • Corn or flour tortillas
  • Vegetable oil
  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Salsa or hot sauce
  • Cooking oil spray (optional)

Spices

  • Ground cumin
  • Smoked paprika
  • Oregano
  • Chilli powder (optional)

Proteins

  • None (vegetarian)

Other

  • Grated cheese (cheddar or Mexican blend)
  • Sour cream or Greek yoghurt (optional)
  • Pickled jalape√±os (optional)

Utensils List

  • Frying pan
  • Spatula
  • Small knife
  • Chopping board
  • Spoon
  • Optional: skillet for warming tortillas

Ingredients (2 servings)

  • 1 can refried beans (400g) or 1 can pinto/black beans, lightly mashed
  • 1 tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1 small onion, finely chopped
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • 1 tsp ground cumin
  • 1 tsp smoked paprika
  • ¬Ω tsp oregano
  • Salt & pepper to taste
  • 4‚Äì6 tortillas
  • 50g grated cheese
  • 1 tomato, diced
  • Lime wedges
  • Fresh coriander, chopped (optional)
  • Salsa or hot sauce

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Chop the onion, garlic, tomato, and coriander.
  2. Grate the cheese.
  3. Warm tortillas in a skillet or microwave.
  4. Open refried beans can and set aside.

Cooking Instructions

  1. Saut√© aromatics
    Heat 1 tbsp oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook 3‚Äì4 minutes until soft. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more.

item.title: Steak Tacos
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 1 lime
  • 1 onion
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • Fresh coriander (small bunch)
  • 2 tomatoes
  • 1‚Äì2 jalape√±os (optional)

Pantry

  • Soft corn or flour tortillas
  • Olive oil
  • Rice vinegar or white vinegar
  • Sugar (pinch, optional for pico de gallo)

Spices

  • Salt
  • Black pepper
  • Ground cumin
  • Paprika
  • Oregano

Proteins

  • 400‚Äì500g steak (sirloin, rump, or flank‚Äîany UK supermarket cut works)

Other

  • Your favourite hot sauce (optional)

Utensils List

  • Cast-iron pan or heavy frying pan
  • Chopping board
  • Sharp knife
  • Bowl for salsa
  • Tongs

Ingredients (2‚Äì3 servings)

  • 400‚Äì500g steak (thinly sliced or cooked whole then sliced)
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tsp salt
  • ¬Ω tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp ground cumin
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • ¬Ω tsp oregano
  • 2 garlic cloves, minced
  • Juice of 1 lime
  • 6‚Äì8 tortillas

For pico de gallo:

item.title: Vegetable Broth
item.description:
Grocery List

Produce

  • 3 carrots
  • 2 celery stalks
  • 2 onions
  • 1 leek (optional but recommended)
  • 4 garlic cloves
  • 1 handful fresh parsley
  • 2 bay leaves

Pantry

  • Olive oil
  • 2 litres water

Spices

  • Salt
  • Black peppercorns

Proteins

  • None

Other

  • Optional: leftover vegetable scraps (peels, ends, herbs)

Utensils

  • Large stock pot
  • Knife & chopping board
  • Ladle
  • Fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth
  • Storage containers

Ingredients (Makes ~2 Litres)

  • 3 carrots, roughly chopped
  • 2 celery stalks, roughly chopped
  • 2 onions, quartered
  • 1 leek, sliced
  • 4 garlic cloves, smashed
  • 1 handful parsley
  • 2 bay leaves
  • 1 tsp peppercorns
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 2 litres water
  • Salt to taste

Meal Prep Steps

  1. Wash all vegetables thoroughly; no need to peel unless dirty.
  2. Roughly chop everything ‚Äî large chunks are fine.
  3. Keep any clean vegetable scraps from other meals (onion skins, carrot peels, celery tops) in a freezer bag to add to the pot.

Cooking Instructions

  1. Heat the olive oil in a large stockpot over medium heat.
  2. Add onions, carrots, celery, leek, and garlic. Saut√© 5 minutes to develop flavour.
  3. Add parsley, bay leaves, peppercorns, and any vegetable scraps.
  4. Pour in 2 litres of water.
  5. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer.
  6. Simmer uncovered for 60‚Äì90 minutes.
  7. Strain the broth through a fine mesh sieve or cheesecloth.
  8. Season with salt to taste.
  9. Cool completely before storing.

Storage & Reheating Instructions

  • Fridge: Store in sealed containers for up to 5 days.
  • Freezer: Freeze in portioned containers or ice cube trays for 3 months.
  • Reheat: Bring to a gentle simmer on the stove. Do not boil vigorously, as flavour may dull.

item.title: Indian inspired pork on an air fryer
item.description:
üõí Shopping List for Indian-Spiced Air Fryer Meal

(Servings: 3‚Äì4)

ü•© Protein

  • 1 pork tenderloin (600‚Äì800 g)

ü•î Vegetables & Starch

  • 400‚Äì500 g potatoes (baby or standard, any variety)
  • 300 g green beans
  • 250 g asparagus
  • 1 lemon (for finishing)

üåø Spices (Only buy what’s missing)

You already have:

  • Cumin seeds
  • Coriander seeds
  • Turmeric
  • Garam masala
  • Ground coriander
  • Ground cinnamon
  • Hot chilli powder
  • Cardamom pods
  • Whole cloves

Optional if you want to enhance:

item.title: Air fryer salmon with asparagus
item.description:
Air Fryer Salmon + Asparagus Tips

A quick, simple method to cook both salmon and asparagus tips together in the air fryer.

Ingredients (2 servings)

  • 2 salmon fillets (150‚Äì200 g each)
  • 200 g asparagus tips
  • 1‚Äì2 tsp olive oil
  • Salt + pepper

Optional seasonings

  • Lemon juice or slices
  • Paprika, garlic powder, chilli flakes
  • Butter for finishing
  • Fresh herbs (dill, parsley, thyme)

Instructions

1. Prep the salmon

  1. Pat salmon dry.
  2. Rub lightly with olive oil.
  3. Season with salt, pepper, and optional paprika/garlic powder.
  4. Add lemon slices on top if using.

2. Prep the asparagus

  1. Toss asparagus in a bowl with a drizzle of olive oil.
  2. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Optional: Add minced garlic or a squeeze of lemon.

3. Air fry

  1. Preheat air fryer to 190¬∞C (375¬∞F) for 3‚Äì4 minutes.
  2. Place salmon fillets skin-side down in the basket.
  3. Add the asparagus tips around the salmon.
  4. Cook 8‚Äì10 minutes total.

Tip: Start checking from 8 minutes.
Salmon should flake easily and reach 52‚Äì55¬∞C (125‚Äì130¬∞F) for medium.
Asparagus should be tender-crisp and bright green.

item.title: Ground beef with potatoes, Mexican style
item.description:
üå∂Ô∏è Ground Beef with Potatoes & Mexican Chiles

A spicy, saucy, high-protein meal prep for 3 days.

üõí Ingredients (for 4 servings ‚Äì scaled for 3-day meal prep below)

  • 500 g ground beef (10‚Äì15% fat)
  • 2 medium potatoes, diced
  • 3 medium tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 medium onion, diced
  • 2 garlic cloves
  • 1 ancho chile
  • 1 guajillo chile
  • 1 chipotle in adobo + 1 tsp adobo sauce
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • ¬Ω tsp smoked paprika
  • 1 bay leaf
  • Salt & pepper
  • 1 tbsp oil

üî• FULL RECIPE (4 servings)

1. Chile Sauce

  1. Remove stems/seeds from ancho & guajillo.
  2. Toast 10‚Äì15 sec each side.
  3. Soak in hot water 10 min.
  4. Blend with:
    • garlic
    • chipotle + adobo
    • cumin, oregano, paprika
    • 1 cup water/stock
    • pinch salt
    • optional 1 tsp vinegar/lime
  5. Strain if you want it smoother.

2. Cook the Dish

  1. Brown beef in oil.
  2. Add onion ‚Üí cook 3‚Äì4 min.
  3. Add garlic ‚Üí 30 sec.
  4. Add potatoes ‚Üí cook 5 min.
  5. Add tomatoes ‚Üí soften 3‚Äì5 min.
  6. Add chile sauce + bay leaf.
  7. Simmer 20‚Äì25 min until potatoes are tender.
  8. Adjust salt, acidity, or thickness.

üç± MEAL PREP FOR 3 DAYS

3 meals = 3 servings

item.title: Mexican dhal
item.description:
üå∂Ô∏è Spicy Potato Dhal with Guajillo, Ancho & Chipotle

One-Pot ‚Ä¢ Mexican‚ÄìIndian Fusion ‚Ä¢ Serves 2‚Äì3

ü•ò Ingredients

Lentils & Potatoes

  • 1 cup red lentils, rinsed
  • 2 medium potatoes, peeled & diced
  • 1 medium onion, chopped
  • 3 cloves garlic, minced (or add to puree)
  • 1‚Äì2 tsp ginger, grated
  • 1 tomato, chopped (or add to puree)
  • 1 tsp turmeric
  • 1.5 tsp ground cumin
  • 1.5 tsp ground coriander
  • 1‚Äì2 tsp chilli powder
  • ¬Ω tsp crushed chilli flakes
  • ¬Ω tsp black pepper
  • 1 tsp garam masala
  • 1‚Äì2 tbsp oil
  • 3‚Äì3.5 cups water
  • 1 tsp salt, adjust to taste

Mexican Chilli Puree

  • 1 guajillo chilli, destemmed & deseeded
  • ¬Ω‚Äì1 ancho chilli, destemmed & deseeded
  • ¬Ω‚Äì1 chipotle chilli in adobo, chopped
  • Hot water (for soaking)

üî• Instructions

1. Prepare the Mexican chilli puree

  1. Heat a dry pan over medium heat.
  2. Toast the guajillo and ancho pieces for 10‚Äì15 seconds per side until fragrant.
  3. Transfer them to a bowl and cover with hot water.
  4. Soak for 10 minutes until soft.
  5. Add the softened chillies to a blender with:
    • 2‚Äì3 tbsp soaking liquid
    • The chipotle
    • (Optional) garlic and tomato for a smoother base
  6. Blend until very smooth.
  7. Set aside.

2. Saut√© the aromatics

  1. Heat 1‚Äì2 tbsp oil in a pot over medium heat.
  2. Add chopped onion and cook for 5 minutes.
  3. Add ginger and cook 30 seconds.
  4. If not blended into the puree, add garlic and tomato and cook a minute more.

3. Fry the Mexican chilli puree

  1. Pour the chilli puree into the pot.
  2. Cook for 2‚Äì3 minutes, stirring, until it darkens and thickens slightly.

4. Add the Indian spices

Add and cook for 30‚Äì45 seconds:
